headline: Philly Steak Sandwich
description: This Philly cheesesteak recipe has the best seasoning and is stuffed with sauteed beef, onions, and green peppers and covered with melted Swiss cheese.

video.description: Who wants a sandwich packed with steak and cheese?
video.name: Philly Steak Sandwich

name: Philly Steak Sandwich
recipeIngredient: 1 pound beef sirloin, cut into thin 2 inch strips

recipeInstructions.text: Mix together salt, pepper, paprika, chili powder, onion powder, garlic powder, thyme, marjoram, and basil in a small bowl.
Place beef in a large bowl. Sprinkle seasoning mixture over top and stir to coat.
Heat 1/2 of the oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add beef and saute to the desired doneness. Remove to a plate.
Heat the remaining oil in the skillet. Add onion and green pepper and saute until tender.
Preheat the oven on the broiler setting.
Divide cooked beef between the bottoms of 4 rolls. Layer with onion and green pepper, then top with sliced cheese. Place on a cookie sheet.
Broil in the preheated oven until cheese is melted.
Cover with tops of rolls and serve.

review.reviewBody: I used all the seasonings on the recipe,but the veggies I used green peppers,white onion, and a red onion. Instead of chez whiz and provolone, I used swiss and mozzarella cheese sticks and diced them up and added to the steak, onions and peppers. And for us budget minded and rib eye steak is not an option. I used flank steak cut into strips,mixed the seasonings in and let sit in fridge to tenderize the meat. Came out really good. I also used hamburger buns to cut carbs.
The seasoning is wonderful! I just used rib eye steak sliced thinly only different is I served it on grilled ciabatta(sp) bread with sauteed peppers and onions.. and Swiss cheese.. Yummy!
Delicious!

Turned out great the first time. The store had shaved beef specifically for Philly Cheese Steak, so I used that. It cooked quickly and made it a lot easier. Family loved it and had no complaints or suggested changes.

Iâ€™ve never been to Philadelphia, I was just in search of a well seasoned steak sandwich and this recipe definitely fit the bill! I didnâ€™t change a thing in the recipe, I did however let the meat sit in the seasoning mixture overnight. Delicious and I will definitely be using this recipe from now on.

Loved the spice mix! The key is to thinly slice the meat and fry long enough to start caramelization of the spice/meat mix. Added mushrooms and used provolone cheese instead of swiss and it was excellent! Also topped the sandwich with some candied jalapenos (cowboy candy) for added spice. Will definitely make this again! Thanks for the recipe!

This was great! I did sub the Swiss cheese for provolone however, and I sautÃ©d my veggies 1st then added the meat to sautÃ© together. I also used the really thin steak thatâ€™s purposed to make cheese steaks. My husband raved about it!ðŸ˜‰

So good! We used provolone, of course. Also, added oregano, ground bay leaf, and white pepper. Our meat could have been more thinly sliced, but the flavor was incredible! We had sauteed mushrooms on the side for whoever wanted some.
Very good! My wife liked it as well. Quick and easy to make.
First this was a good recipe I used provolone and gotta have some cheese wiz if your gonna have a provy
Loved it!! What great flavor it had!
This is a pretty good recipe. Itâ€™s easy to make and pretty tasty. We made it to the recipe, but I will probably try some changes to it, in the future.
Although it made some tasty steak sandwiches, they did not taste like a true Philly cheese steak. If the recipe title was not misleading, would of given it 4 stars.

Substituted basil with parsley. Husband thought the chilli powder was overpowering. I thought the sandwich was a little dry. But it was really tasty. Will definitely try again and maybe tweak it a little to make it Saucier. ??????

I used leftover medium-rare steak, sliced very thinly and cut into bite sized pieces. I also used roasted capsicum (red peppers) from a jar, as I didn't have any fresh. Really great flavour! Served on tortilla wraps, which is melted slices of cheese onto in the microwave, and topped with garlic aioli. Whole family loved it.
I used all of the stated ingredients except the steak. I found it much easier to go to the local deli and get a package of sliced roast beef. Itâ€™s much easier to heat and place on the hoagie.
Broiled the buns before adding meat and also after with meat , onions, green peppers and mushrooms.
Added fresh mushrooms to the sautÃ© and a splash of Worcestershire...Oh My!
It was quick and easy and most of all delicious!

Didn't have any marjoram so skipped that, didn't have onion powder so skipped salt and used onion salt instead. Unfortunately I added salt (about 1 tsp?) and pepper on the veggies as well and that made it too salty - especially since eaten without bread. That said, I absolutely love this spice blend and will save for future use! Just no additional/less added salt to the veggies.
This was fantastic! Wouldn't change a thing!

I used T-bone steak for the beef. I also added a tablespoon of Worcestershire sauce to the beef and veggie mix. This turned out real good. I used olive oil instead of vegetable oil. The food was on point and not fatty grease.
One of the best philly's I've had!

Simple recipe. A little too much thyme for me. It was just a bit overpowering. Served with mini hoagie buns which were perfect size for most of the family. Some ate 2 of them. My husband would have like au jus. He was thinking of a french dip but there isn't au jus with philly steak so maybe next time we make french dip, we will save some au jus and freeze for this recipe. Thanks for sharing.
really good
No changes this time.
Made the meat just as described and it was delicious! My kids loved it too!! Even though I put it in a pita with cheddar and mozzarella. Itâ€™s all I had. Still delicious.
Good recipe...made last night for dinner and. the family was happy and full.

I had a little steak left over from steak night so I tried this recipe. I was a little skeptical about the spice cocktail but followed it to the T. I used a ciabatta roll because that's what I had on hand. The spices made that sandwich one of the best I've ever eaten. Thanks!
i put it in the air fryer 400 for 7 min instead of the oven. turned out yummy!

I love the flavor of the seasoning blend. I sauteed the veggies first. I used shaved beef that I picked up from Target, tossed it in the seasoning mix, and seared it in a hot cast iron skillet until the beef was cooked through and had some crisp edges. The cook time was minimal for the beef because it's shaved so thin. 
The meat was so flavorful that my husband asked for this at least once a month!
I made it today. It was very tasty. Will make again.

Not the best cheese steak I've had, but not the worst. Wish I had not used my best ribeye in the freezer :(
Next time I'll leave out all the spices and just salt and pepper
Used thin provolone and butter to saute the steak and vegetables. Marinated meat in seasoning and olive oil for 6 hours. Rob liked it so making it again, Thanks.
Delicious
Loved it...would make it again
The meat was seasoned well. I added some chopped pickled jalapeno with the green pepper and onions and served on crusty rolls. Makes for a very good soup and sandwich lunch â€¦ I had tomato.

I made the "Philly" using 80/20 ground beef, (that's what I had on hand) and served it over a bed of lettuce. I know it's not the original recipe, but the flavor was the same, without the calories and carbs associated with the bread. Update: With the leftovers, I added a diced/sauted jalapeno pepper and about a teaspoon of red pepper flakes. It really kicked it up a notch!
Great sandwich. Didn't have provolone, so cubed up pepperjack cheese and mixed in with meat and veggies. Fantastic!

So I was very disappointed in this sandwich I knew something was off when it said to cut the meat into 2 inch slices but I continued. The seasonings were good but maybe it was the beer I picked for the meat but right now I'm eating this sandwich and all I can taste is PBR ????. I won't make this again.

These are delicious! Love the spice mixture - makes the meat so flavourful (had all the spices on hand except for the marjoram). Also the key is to have super thin slices of steak. We tried both provolone and swiss and both were good. Next time I'll try what other reviewers have said...melt the cheese on the meat and stir together.
rubbed spice mix over roast with a little olive oil and let set overnight. Cooked in slow cooker then shredded for sandwiches. Allowed guests to top anyway they liked.
We love this recipe. Make it on a regular basis. I am on a keto diet so I just omit the bun. Fantastic meal.
Mb

This was really good! My husband and older kids loved it! I sautÃ©ed the veggies separately from the meat and then added them together at the end for a couple minutes to make sure it didnâ€™t come out watery. Worked great.
I made no change and it was great! !!!
Everyone like them.

This is a fantastic recipe! The seasonings for the steak are so tasty! My family loved it. Definitely a keeper. The only change I made to the recipe was to use provolone cheese instead of swiss. One of the times I made it the grocery store was out of hoagie buns so I used ciabatta rolls. My family actually liked that even better.
I added mushrooms! Yummy!
Hubby loved it! I used hoagie rolls as suggested, he said it was too much bun.
Yummy! Thank you. The only change I made was I used mozzarella cheese because that is what I had on hand.

Fantastic sandwich! 
Some complained that it isn't an original Philly. Fine. it's not, but it is delicious! I only added soy sauce to the oil. All else was the same and so freaking good! Thank you for sharing
This was a great dish for lunch. Iâ€™ve had a Philly Cheesesteak Sandwich before so I cannot compare to others but this still tasted great. I made one change, Mozzarella instead of Swiss.
I grading on the taste, not how authentic it is, and it was delicious.
It was a really good sandwich, if it is a Philly one though I think we would have to agree to disagree. I really enjoyed anyway. I would say try it out as taste is one of those very personal choices.

Great recipe. Simple. Delicious. I am adding this to list of regular go-to weeknight meals.

That being said, provolone is better on a cheesesteak than swiss. Other than that, I didn't change anything.
authentic cheesesteaks are made with either white american. Some say Cheese Whiz, but white american all the way

These were awesome! Like other reviewers, I switched from Swiss to Provolone (three slices per sandwich because I like it cheesy). The meat seasoning was awesome! I sauteed everything in butter instead of oil, because I like the flavor better. I also buttered the top bun a little before throwing them in the oven to broil. Next time I will make a roasted garlic butter spread to put on the top bun. Sooooo good!
Definitely worth the time and effort. A hit with my family and worth it for yours

Added mushrooms to onion/pepper saute. Added 1 T Worcestershire sauce to meat. Used Havarti cheese (all I had).
Excellent sandwich--hubby loved them.

I knew I shouldn't have added the thyme! However, I have never been a huge fan of thyme but in my opinion and the opinion of my family, the thyme overwhelmed the entire flavor of this dish. I did follow the recipe EXACTLY too! The meat came out nice and tender so that was a plus! Would make again but absolutely no thyme next time!! LOL
This was just mouth-watering delicious. Used the leftovers from Prime Rib and added a can of French Onion soup. To die for. Thank you!
Tasty sandwiches and easy to make. I was out of dried basil and onion powder and they still tasted great. I will definitely make this again but I will double or triple the onions and green peppers.
Will make again, very easy recipe. No complaints.
It was delicious!! The papers take longer than the onions of course.
no
Very tasty, the whole family enjoyed these sandwiches!

I added red bell peppers, yellow bell peppers and lots of onions. Also, I only had mozzarella cheese so I used that instead. It came out great EXCEPT it was pretty dry. Next time I will add a little mayo to each side of the breads.
Made as written it was ok not great. The thyme was WAY overpowering. If I were to make it again I would reduce thyme by half.
Did not like the flavor of the meat. Too herby. Will not make again

We loved it! Wonderful recipe! Of course, I used provolone and I sauteed mushrooms. I also stuffed an Anaheim pepper with cream cheese. mozzarella, garlic and onion powder, salt and pepper and through it into the broiler while melting the cheese on the meat. It went along with it so well. I will make this often!!!
Wonderful spice combination, we are having them again today. (3rd time)

This was very tasty. I added mushrooms to the onion and green pepper, used provolone instead of Swiss and cut a loaf of French bread in half since I couldn't find hoagie buns. Otherwise I followed the recipe. I will definitely make it again.

I cooked this tonight and it was pretty good in my opinion. My husband on the other hand loved it . I tweaked it a bit and instead of just "frying it I boiled it with the ingredients and added fresh garlic, Lea and Perrins , a little finely sliced celery and 4 table spoons of butter . Put in the veggies and saute'd them till tender and made an au jus out of the drippings .I used Muenster cheese just for a try and it worked for us . I'll make this for him again but don't think I'll have it . Maybe with chicken breast ? I'm ashamed to admit I'm a very picky eater I read too much how food is made
We really liked the seasoning in this sandwich.

Cut the steak into really small cubes instead of slicing the meat. After we mixed the seasonings onto the meat, we let marinate in frig for about 1/2 hour. Combination of spices gave very good flavor to the steak. Really liked this sandwich a lot!!

I made this it's an easy recipe. My only problem with it is that Basil is a strong spice so the first time I made it , I tasted to much Basil for my taste. So the next time I just cut the amount in half and worked out great. Simple , easy and doesn't take to much time to make.
Very flavorful meat. Good recipe. I will make this again
Will make again and again !!
Absolutely love this spice combination!! Delicious! Use skirt steak and provolone instead of swiss now, personal pref. Have made several times. Definitely a favorite! Thanks Swizzlesticks!!

I love this recipe. The things I did different was I used NY strip steak (i had on hand,). I sliced the meat with my food processor. I used provolone cheese. I also added mushrooms (just a preference). I also didn't have marjoram on hand, but the seasoning was still wonderful. I have a son who is a picky eater and He loved this (with the steak and cheese only). I will definitely be making this again.
Well seasoned and easy to make...delicious ??
This is a crowd pleaser!

I really enjoyed these sandwiches. I used beef knuckle and sliced the meat as thin as possible, then seasoned the meat and peppers and onions with the above seasonings. I also made a spread for the bread.
The sandwiches were so delicious! We changed the meat to deli cut roast beef however, and they were fantastic!!
This is a pretty good steak sandwich. The Swiss cheese is really all wrong for it to be a Philly though. If I make it again, I'll use Cheez Whiz or at the very least provolone.
Great Recipe!
This seasoning was delish, but the whole sand which was dry. Next time i will make sure I have ajus to dip the sand which in! Sherry M
Really good recipe. I highly recommend it, and that's coming from a picky eater. Seasoning goes great with the meat. This makes for a really good lunch or even a quick dinner. Two thumbs up!

The spices were perfect, add a little olive oil to make a marinating paste. Use a better cut of meat. I used fajita cut beef and it doesn't cut it.Next time I have rib eyes sliced by the butcher. Provolone was better than swiss :)Added sliced mushrooms to the veggies.It was great!
I have made this several times now. Using top sirloin sliced into 1/4 in slices I marinate in the paste for a hour or two. Saute the meat until med rare, remove and saute veges then assemble and broil :)

Used rib-eye steak sliced real thin, put in the freezer for about 15 minutes to make it easy to slice. I used provolone, and husband had Swiss. I also didn't broil the buns, just toasted on the griddle. Lay the cheese on your cooked meat on the griddle and it will melt, use the spatula to slop it all on your bun, that way the cheese mixes in with the meat.
I made this into a pastry round making sure to drain well and it was a hit
Great recipe- make it all the time. Everyone LOVES it!
I've made this several times as is. It may not be exactly philly style, but is very good.
I'm sorry, but not only did we feel the spices didn't create a balanced flavor, it smelled the opposite of delicious when cooking it. I wished I passed on this.
Very very good. Instead of sirloin try skirt steak and cut it very thin across the grain, very tender and delicious. I also added mushrooms and used red peppers instead if green. Yummy

This was great, the seasoning on the steak is perfect! Be sure to cut against the grain, or it will be tough. I used red bell pepper instead of green, and did add a touch of mayo to mine as I can't live without a condiment on my bread lol! Very good!
Great seasoning. I used provolone cheese instead of swiss, and subbed mushrooms for the green peppers, just for taste preference. Turned out very good. The kids especially liked it.

'Sgood! I really liked the spice mixture and these were excellent served with homemade baked fries. I made this exactly as written EXCEPT for the cheese. Used provolone instead of Swiss because I just couldn't see it any other way. Next time I'll hang onto the spice mix, but I prefer steak sandwiches a tad sloppier. And juicier. This was a little dry. So next time I'll probably just mix everything together and let it all cook together then throw cheese on top and cover it to melt everything together before scooping it into a bun. But there will definitely be a next time, so thank you!
